translated: . The Chapter with Paduma and Kesara
the world’s chief, the bull of a man.
Raising my joined palms,🔽I invited him to my home.
Having invited the Buddha,🔽I gave him the best food.
I gave the best food then.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the best food.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā paramannadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā paramannadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha taught.”🔽Thus the elder Paramannadāyaka recited these verses.
The Elder Paramannadāyaka’s Birth Story, the third.
